boat.name: Naida
boat.full_description:
'Naida' was built by her firstst owner starting in 1999, finishing in 2011. 95% of the timber came from within a mile of where she was built, most of it coming from trees that were brought down by the 'Great Storm' of October 1987. She has no imported timber in her construction. Designed by Paul Fisher, she is based on the 'Pinky Ketches' of the19th century on East Coast of the USA.

She was launched into the River Thames in 2011, and motored down to London where she was rigged. Her maiden voyage was to the Isles of Scilly.
boat.construction_details: Laminated oak ribs, oak frames, keel and hog. Strip plank Thuja overlaid with 2 oak veneers.
boat.short_description: 'Naida' was built by her first owner. Her design is based on the mid 19th century 'Pinky Ketches' of the East Coast of the USA. She is built almost entirely from timber collected from the Great Storm of 1987, all of this came from within a mile of where she was built.
